guó: (графема) государство, страна, нация
guó: (графема) национальный, представляющий страну; лучший в стране; китайский
Kanshudo_mnemonic: a certain (或) enclosure (囗) = your country
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: In my country (England) the crown jewels are kept pent in in the Tower of London which happens to be where enemies of the state were once also pent-in (probably for trying to steal those jewels).
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze text starts with "囗", " or " sound. Warring States or from " imports " from the " contraband ", " 𠃊 " is a righteous character area boundary. " Or " is a sound symbol. The original meaning is country. "Shuowen": "Country, state. From 囗cong or." Duan Yucai's note: "<Yibu> said: "State, country." According to the state and country, it is a good word. "Zhou "Ritual" notes: "Big is a country, and a small is a country." The country where a country lives is also a country, and it is also an analysis of words." "The Gebu" said: "Or, Bangye." The ancient or country and the country are used together. "Bonus is used in the same way." Xu Hao said: "Bang is the country, and the border of the border is the domain. In ancient times, the word " or " was used as it." For example, the inscription " or " is used to represent " country ", He Zun: " Zhaizizhong or (country)" means living in the middle of the country. In ancient times, " guo " and " domain " were similar in sound and meaning, so it should be interpreted as "zhaizizhong or (domain)", which means living in the central area. See also " medium ", " or ".

Seen from the " country " of "囗" in the Western Zhou Dynasty, the Bronze inscription is used as the original meaning, 彔卣: "Huaishi (Yi) dare to attack the inner country" Cai Houzhong: "Build our nation."

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period and the Han silk script also indicate the country. "Parents of the People" Jane 13: "It (Shi) and the Four Kingdoms". "Mawangdui Silk Book. The 200th line of the Old Unused Book of Lao Zi Jiaben: "Happiness is virtue, and virtue is country and "Xing"." "Mawangdui Silk Book. Line 10 of the Book of Strategists in the Warring States Period: "It is not good for the country, and I am worried about it." "Mawangdui Silk Book. Line 233 of Laozi's Second Edition: "The country is in a mess, and there are Zhenchen ministers in peace." Chapter 18: "The country is in a mess, and there are loyal ministers."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription from "囗", " or " sound. "囗" is like the border and territory of a country. The original meaning is country.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「囗」，「或」聲。戰國文字或不從「囗」而從「匚」、「𠃊」，是表示區域、邊界的義符。「或」是聲符。本義是國家。《說文》：「國，邦也。从囗从或。」段玉裁注：「〈邑部〉曰：『邦，國也。』按邦、國互訓，渾言之也。《周禮》注曰：『大曰邦，小曰國。』邦之所居亦曰國，析言之也。」「〈戈部〉曰：『或，邦也。』古或、國同用。邦、封同用。」徐灝曰：「邦謂之國，封疆之界謂之域，古但以或字為之。」如甲金文用「或」來表示「國」，何尊：「宅茲中或（國）」，表示居住在國家中部。古代「國」、「域」音義皆近，故一說應釋為「宅茲中或（域）」，表示在中心的區域居住。參見「中」、「或」。

　　從「囗」的「國」見於西周，金文用作本義，彔卣：「淮尸（夷）敢伐內國」。蔡侯鐘：「建我邦國」。

　　戰國竹簡和漢帛書也表示國家，《上博竹書二．民之父母》簡13：「它（施）及四國」。《馬王堆帛書．老子甲本卷後古佚書》第200行：「樂則有德，有德則國家與〈興〉。」《馬王堆帛書．戰國縱橫家書》第10行：「不利於國，且我憂之。」《馬王堆帛書．老子乙本》第233行：「國家昏亂，安有貞臣。」《老子．第十八章》：「國家昏亂，有忠臣。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「囗」，「或」聲。「囗」象國家的邊界、領域。本義是國家。

Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: Treasure 或 within a country's borders 囗
  • ⿴ Full surround
    • 囗 [ wéi ] enclosure; border
    • 或 [ huò ] or, either, else; maybe, perhaps, possibly
①有土地、人民、主權的政體(古代指諸侯所受封的地域)：國家。國土。國體(ａ．國家的性質；b．國家的體面)。國號。國度(指國家)。國策。國情。國法。國力。國防。國威。國寶(ａ．國家的寶物；b．喻對國家有特殊貢獻的人)。國格。國魂。國是(國家大計，如“共商國國”)。
②特指中國的：國產。國貨。國粹。國樂。國藥。
③姓氏。

Story: In my country (England) the crown jewels are kept pent in in the Tower of London which happens to be where enemies of the state were once also pent-in (probably for trying to steal those jewels).
Kind: traditional

金文從「 囗 」，「 或 」聲。戰國文字或不從「 囗 」而從「 匚 」、「 𠃊 」，是表示區域、邊界的義符。「 或 」是聲符。本義是國家。《說文》：「國，邦也。从囗从或。」段玉裁注：「〈邑部〉曰：『邦，國也。』按邦、國互訓，渾言之也。《周禮》注曰：『大曰邦，小曰國。』邦之所居亦曰國，析言之也。」「〈戈部〉曰：『或，邦也。』古或、國同用。邦、封同用。」徐灝曰：「邦謂之國，封疆之界謂之域，古但以或字為之。」如甲金文用「 或 」來表示「 國 」，何尊：「宅茲中或（國）」，表示居住在國家中部。古代「 國 」、「 域 」音義皆近，故一說應釋為「宅茲中或（域）」，表示在中心的區域居住。參見「 中 」、「 或 」。 從「 囗 」的「 國 」見於西周，金文用作本義，彔卣：「淮尸（夷）敢伐內國」。蔡侯鐘：「建我邦國」。 戰國竹簡和漢帛書也表示國家，《上博竹書二．民之父母》簡13：「它（施）及四國」。《馬王堆帛書．老子甲本卷後古佚書》第200行：「樂則有德，有德則國家與〈興〉。」《馬王堆帛書．戰國縱橫家書》第10行：「不利於國，且我憂之。」《馬王堆帛書．老子乙本》第233行：「國家昏亂，安有貞臣。」《老子．第十八章》：「國家昏亂，有忠臣。」
